TopicTitle: [0.25] RasterPropMonitor - putting the A in your IVA (v0.18.3) [8 Oct]

Articles.Content:
OK finally figure out everything, thanks for help. I didn't want to move too many panels, I moved two. I wanted to keep everything as close as the designer of pod had.

For this pod:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/60974-Stock-alike-two-man-command-pod-%28for-1-25m-parts%29

Here is pictures of interior:

Edited December 9, 2013 by therealcrow999

I got it, trying to figure out how to save now.

In the KSP parts Tool there is a readme, it touches on using the scripts and tools. Read that first. To save the config, select the internal view from the hierarchical menu on the left of the screen. Then on the right you will see an option to "save to config." Doing this will over-write the original config, create a backup.

OK finally figure out everything, thanks for help. I didn't want to move too many panels, I moved two. I wanted to keep everything as close as the designer of pod had.

Since I am on a roll, I did one for the mk2 Lander can. I have it all done, but not going to put it up here yet. I am going to slap one in the mk1 Lander can.

Here is picture of the mk2 Lander Can one. I added some buttons and switches, it looked kind of naked there:

For mk1, the one spot I want to put it at, is the spot where the electrical symbol is. That is a nice size square for the MFD and the little square to right I am going to put another navball. The other navball is to help out docking when using the MFD camera.

There is no room by front window to put the MFD and I don't want to move stuff around. I think a side MFD would be ok, it's better then not having on at all.

OK, I finished the stock lander cans. I really don't know if anyone has done this, but here is mine.

Download link:

http://www./view/mltyav16l77y93j/Lander%20Cans%20MFD.cfg

Here is link to Module Manager 1.5:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/55219-Module-Manager-1-5-(Nov-11)

Down below is code if you have your own MM file.

mk2 lander can, I added some buttons around MFD so it didn't look so naked. I moved MFD downa a little from previous picture. This way a player could see the navball a little more for docks.

mk1 can, I was originally going to put MFD to left, but FOV wouldn't allow close ups. So I opt to do it like in the picture, which I like much more.

}

Yeah go ahead. I think I got all stock stuff.

I had fun putting them in. The only pain is unity camera angles.

I'll include that in the package if you don't mind.

@Mihara, I kind of improved on your mk1-2 pod stock. I did two for front, I doesn't look to bad. The MFD's seem like they fit there and don't look like they stick out. Almost go with the flow of cockpit. If you want to try them out or if someone wants to try them out code is below.


@PART[Mark1-2Pod]
{
	MODULE 
	{
		name = JSIInternalPersistence
	}
}

@INTERNAL[PodCockpit] 
{

	MODULE 
	{
		name = InternalCameraTargetHelper
	}

	PROP
	{
		name = RasterPropMonitorExampleMFD
		position = -0.04700108,-0.7001308,-0.2760131
		rotation = -0.3221054,0.001163236,-0.01229838,0.9466232
		scale = 0.42,0.42,0.42
	}
	PROP
	{
		name = RasterPropMonitorExampleMFD
		position = -0.1301768,0.3727174,-0.6577022
		rotation = -0.1658574,-0.1258607,-0.004473958,0.9780748
		scale = 0.5831207,0.5831207,0.5831208
	}
	PROP
	{
		name = RasterPropMonitorExampleMFD
		position = 0.1654501,0.3631889,-0.6548982
		rotation = -0.1690952,0.1214759,-0.02113059,0.9778568
		scale = 0.583121,0.5831209,0.5831211
	}
}

Edited December 11, 2013 by therealcrow999

Well I think it will be enough for me. Bu WATCH OUT the Mk3 Cockpit mod has some lines in the part.cfg which aren't yet made compatible for 0.21 SAS system. It is quite easy to edit, just don't copy the part.cfg included in the Mk3 Cockpit mod download. Just change the line which decides which internal is used to the name of the new internal. I don't know how it is called but you will see

Edited December 10, 2013 by DasBananenbrot

Yeah send it to me, it wouldn't hurt.

I ended up making a MM file to load the internal instead of the one the modder had to overwrite file. Sorry this is for MK2.

Yeah send them to me, the cfg for this is all over place (MK3).

Well I think it will be enough for me. But WATCH OUT the Mk3 Cockpit mod has some lines in the part.cfg which aren't yet made compatible for 0.21 SAS system. It is quite easy to edit but if you want to wait I can send you the edited one (will upload it to dropbox for you)

Post Q
Edited the post and told you how to edit, but I will still send you the cfg just wait a bit. I can do it later in the evening, about one or two hours. If you did it yourself by then just tell me
Do those 3 screen on bottom area work? or are they there for looks?

PM me those later, if you can. I will take a look at them.

Edited the post and told you how to edit, but I will still send you the cfg just wait a bit. I can do it later in the evening, about one or two hours. If you did it yourself by then just tell me

Do those 3 screen on bottom area work? or are they there for looks?

If you're talking about the Mk3 mod cockpit, they sort of work -- they serve as InternalCameraSwitch triggers and put the camera outside the IVA.

So if you're going to plaster MFDs over them, make sure to also remove those InternalCameraSwitch instances.

I will try to make a MM file for this one. I don't like the old mods that makes you overwrite something. MK3 needs some work with file structure.

Well I think it will be enough for me. Bu WATCH OUT the Mk3 Cockpit mod has some lines in the part.cfg which aren't yet made compatible for 0.21 SAS system. It is quite easy to edit, just don't copy the part.cfg included in the Mk3 Cockpit mod download. Just change the line which decides which internal is used to the name of the new internal. I don't know how it is called but you will see

Yep that bugged me too when I downloaded the mod in October. But TohouTorpedo is away atm due to some much more important RL stuff and no one else did modify it already or at least no one told so on the post...
